body:
My current group is too small to worry about thanking them in any 
major way. Of we all thank each other. We have 4 regular volunteers 
and currently having a different member each month volunteering to do 
a presentation. Only occasionally having an outside speaker. 
Sometimes via iChat. 
 
When I was with HAUS in Honolulu, we thanked the volunteers by buying 
them pizza each month at the board meetings. In Boston, we had an 
annual meeting of "activists". 400 strong. Then we had an annual 
picnic for volunteers as well. 
 
I think it never hurts to thank people every chance you can get. 
 
Lynn 
 
 
"Sometimes I wonder whether the world is being run by smart people who 
are putting us on or by imbeciles who really mean it." --Mark Twain
